unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Not Getting Enough Sleep: One and Two-Sided $p$-Values
question_text: The National Sleep Foundation recommends that teens should get $8.5$ to $9.25\text{ hours}$ of sleep each night, but do they? Boris believes that fewer than $15\%$ of students in his high school would say that they get enough sleep. He conducts a survey by randomly selecting students at school and asking them if they get enough sleep. Completing a one-sided $z$ -test for proportions, he calculates his $p$ -value to be $0.93$ . Using the same data, what would the $p$ -value be for a two-sided test?
